articles.title: Agreement on Transfer of U.S. Forces Base in Ryongsan Censured
articles.content:
Agreement on Transfer of U.S. Forces Base in Ryongsan Censured 
    Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Ro Hoe Chan, National Assemblyman from the Democratic Workers' Party, reportedly disclosed on Oct. 15 the content of the agreement on the transfer of the U.S. forces base in Ryongsan recently concluded between south Korea and the U.S., demanding the punishment of the chief negotiator, according to MBC of south Korea.
 He said that as compared with the "agreement" signed between south Korea and the U.S. in 1990, the area of the required site increased by 252,000 phyong and the expenses for the construction swelled by 1.77 billion U.S. dollars at least due to the raise in the standard of facilities and the planned construction of new ones.    
 The agreement still contains unequal factors including south Korea's commitment to cover all expenses for the transfer of the base and a stringent mechanism for pressing the payment of expenses, he noted.

articles.title: Russian Embassy Officials Visit King Tongmyong's Mausoleum
articles.content:
Russian Embassy Officials Visit King Tongmyong's Mausoleum 
    Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Andrei Karlov and officials of the Russian embassy here visited the Mausoleum of King Tongmyong in the suburbs of Pyongyang Tuesday on the occasion of the 56th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Russia.
 While looking round with deep interest the Monument to the Reconstruction of the mausoleum, the shrine, sculptures, the Jongrung Temple and other historical remains, the visitors were briefed on the splendid rebuilding of the tomb as befits the mausoleum of the founder king of the Koguryo dynasty by virtue of the noble patriotism and wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung and  Kim Jong Il.    
 Before leaving the mausoleum, the ambassador said the visit gave him a good knowledge of the Korean history and the deep concern shown by the Korean leadership for the preservation and management of historical relics.

articles.title: Doctorate of Philology Awarded to Korean Researcher in China
articles.content:
Doctorate of Philology Awarded to Korean Researcher in China 
    Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- The DPRK doctorate of philology was awarded to Ri Yong Sun, researcher of the Committee for the Development of the Korean Language in Yanbian, China, in recognition of the great contribution she made to the development of the Korean language by scientifically and theoretically proving and systematizing the necessity to develop the Korean language with the cultured language of Pyongyang as a standard and its significance and practical ways to do so.
 Present at an awarding ceremony held at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday were Kwak Pom Gi, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, who is chairman of the DPRK State Commission for Conferring Degrees and Titles, Kang Chun Gum, secretary general of the commission, and officials concerned.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Nigerian Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Nigerian Delegation
    Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the women's delegation of the Nigerian People's Democratic Party on a visit to the DPRK.
 It was handed to Secretary Jong Ha Chol of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea today by National Women's Leader of the party Josephine Anenih who is heading the delegation.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Visits Zhou Enlai and Deng Yingchao Memorial
DPRK Delegation Visits Tianjin
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Visits Tianjin
    Tianjin, October 20 (KCNA Correspondent) -- The DPRK delegation headed by President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly Kim Yong Nam on an official goodwill visit to China visited Tianjin Municipality today.
  The members of the delegation went round the new residential quarters, the flyover, etc. personally visited by leader Kim Jong Il in April, being briefed on the construction of daily developing Tianjin.    
 On the same day the DPRK delegation met with the mayor of the Tianjin Municipal People's Government and other senior officials of the municipality. It was present on invitation at a reception hosted by the mayor.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves Beijing
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves Beijing
    Beijing, October 20 (KCNA Correspondent) -- The delegation of the DPRK headed by Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, left Beijing by a special plane Wednesday afternoon after successfully winding up its official goodwill visit to the People's Republic of China (PRC).
 The delegation was seen off at the airport by Vice-Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress of the PRC Sheng Huaren, Chinese Ambassador e.p. to the DPRK Wu Donghe, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Zhou Wenzhong and officials concerned.    
 Among the senders-off were DPRK Ambassador e.p. to China Choe Jin Su and embassy officials.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Returns from Its Official Goodwill Visit to China
China to Provide Grant-in-Aid to DPRK
articles.content:
China to Provide Grant-in-Aid to DPRK 
    Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- The government of the People's Republic of China decided to provide grant-in-aid to the DPRK.
 Wu Bangguo, chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress of China, notified Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, of this on October 18 when he was heading the DPRK delegation on its official goodwill visit to China.
